This blog was created to investigate the impacts of COVID-19 on maternal mortality in the United States. The author is Tess Downing, a senior at St. Lawrence University studying Statistics and Public Health. Follow along to learn about how maternal mortality is measured and reported, and how social determinants of health and pre-exisiting comorbidities shaped how pregnant people were affeected during the peak of the pandemic.
